instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Orange Light No Power
threads.message: Hello. Got this board here that initially had no light on charger. It had been poked by another store already and had flux around <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> area. I managed to get green/orange light and 12.56V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> replacing SMC and <CHIP>U7090</CHIP>. Now I have a full short to GND on <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> rail. Tried injecting voltage on that rail, nothing gets hot, so I started removing components. I removed <CAPACITOR>C1910</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C0890</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C0891</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C0892</CAPACITOR> and <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, but short remains. I found after inspection that <RESISTOR>R5310</RESISTOR> was burned. I removed it and it has full short to GND on both pins. Injected voltage on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> rail and PCH gets hot. Dead PCH and RIP board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Orange Light No Power
